summary:
The Ming dynasty (1368â€“1644) was the last Han Chinese imperial dynasty. It followed the Yuan dynasty and was replaced by the Qing dynasty. The Ming was founded by the Hongwu Emperor, who created a strong central government and a large army. The dynasty saw great cultural and technological achievements, including expeditions led by Zheng He.

However, internal struggles, economic issues, and natural disasters weakened the Ming. The dynasty's end came after a rebellion led by Li Zicheng, followed by the Qing dynasty's conquest.
title: Ming dynasty
